data.text:
[𝐐&𝐀 𝐍𝐨. 𝟏] 𝐉𝐚𝐩𝐚𝐧𝐞𝐬𝐞 𝐜𝐮𝐬𝐭𝐨𝐦𝐞𝐫𝐬 & 𝐚𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐚𝐠𝐞 𝐰𝐨𝐫𝐤𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐭𝐢𝐦𝐞 𝐢𝐧 𝐚 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐣𝐞𝐜𝐭 -- ❓ Question: Could you guess how long it will take to finalize a deal with Japanese customers? ✅ Answer: The time to conclude the consulting process for Japanese customers will typically range 𝐟𝐫𝐨𝐦 𝟖 𝐦𝐨𝐧𝐭𝐡𝐬 𝐭𝐨 𝟏 𝐲𝐞𝐚𝐫. However, at RSL Group, the promotion time has been shortened to 𝐣𝐮𝐬𝐭 𝟐 𝐦𝐨𝐧𝐭𝐡𝐬. Specifically, in January this year 2024, we received a request from an international customer to build a new #factory in Northern Vietnam. By March, the signing ceremony of the #MOU between the infrastructure developer - our strategic partner Plaschem Vietnam and RSL Group's customer took place officially at the expanded Dong Van 1 Industrial Park, Ha Nam province. This project serves as a positive signal at the beginning of the year and motivates our team to maintain momentum, striving to accompany investors throughout every stage of the journey. -- 📌 𝑨𝒃𝒐𝒖𝒕 𝒐𝒖𝒓 𝒄𝒍𝒊𝒆𝒏𝒕: Auto System Vietnam Co., Ltd is a 100% Japanese-owned company, headquartered in Fukuoka, Japan. The company specializes in manufacturing #automotive #components and has a previously operating factory in Ha Binh Phuong Industrial Cluster, Hanoi. However, it is soon to be relocated to the expanded Dong Van 1 Industrial Park in Ha Nam province due to the demand for production site #relocation. -- 𝗥𝗦𝗟 𝗚𝗥𝗢𝗨𝗣 – 𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗿𝗲𝗵𝗲𝗻𝘀𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗜𝗻𝘃𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗦𝗼𝗹𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗛𝗼𝘁𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗲: (+84) 912.94.93.93 – Ms Emma 𝗘𝗺𝗮𝗶𝗹: info@rslgroup.vn 𝗪𝗲𝗯𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗲: www.rslgroup.vn #RSLMedia #investment #industrialrealestate #industrialland #vietnam #japan

Singaporean Company Invests Over VND 6 Trillion in High-Tech Project in Hai Duong. Singaporean company Biel Crystal Private Limited has leased over 20 hectares in An Phát 1 Industrial Zone, Hai Duong Province, Vietnam. They plan to invest over VND 6 trillion (approximately USD 260 million) to build a high-tech manufacturing facility for glass and glass-related products, optical equipment, plastic products, technical testing, and more. This project is set to be operational by the second quarter of 2025 and will export 100% of its products. Biel Crystal Private Limited is a major supplier to well-known brands like Samsung, LG, and Apple. The project will create jobs for around 14,000 workers, with 400 of them being foreign laborers. An Phat 1 Industrial Zone aims to become a high-tech and environmentally friendly industrial zone, attracting multiple foreign direct investment projects, especially in manufacturing and processing industries. So far, Hai Duong province's industrial zones have attracted over 340 secondary investment projects, with an investment capital of over USD 5.7 billion. The province is committed to providing a favorable environment for investors, with a strong focus on environmental considerations. #environment #industry #technology #company #netzero #investment #realestate #finance #raising #fundraising

Nippon Express is leasing a recently completed a logistics center in Hokkaido specifically designed for semiconductor materials and related equipment. That means a temperature and humidity-controlled environment, sensors for monitoring internal conditions, and an indoor truck loading lane to protect against snowy winters. The 3-story building with a GFA of 50,000 m2 (538,000 sq.ft) is located in Eniwa City. It’s about 20km from Shin-Chitose Airport and the Sapporo freight terminal, and 40km from Tomakomai Port. It was developed by Obayashi-Shinseiwa Real Estate Corporation. The land is approximately 25,000 m2 with semi-industrial zoning and a maximum FAR of 200%. According to the title, Obayashi-Shinseiwa acquired it in late 2021 from Hokkai Jidosha Kogyo. Specialized semiconductor logistics centers are still rare in Hokkaido, but demand is expected to grow. Next April, Rapidus will commence trial manufacturing in its Chitose plant just one town over from Eniwa. Since the announcement of this chip plant in 2023, the surrounding property markets have exploded. In 2024, three of the top five increases in Government Assessed Land Values (koji-chika) were in Chitose City, with commercial sites seeing growth of up to 30%. Neighboring Eniwa has also seen annual growth in land values in the double digits this year.

EP Manufacturing Bhd ("EPMB" or "Group") reported that our net profit surged more than 50-fold in the financial year ended 31 December 2023 (“FY2023”), the highest since 2014. Revenue crossed the RM600 million mark for the first time ever, helped by strong demand for the Group's products. EPMB’s net profit for FY2023 was RM20.22 million, compared to RM0.40 million in fiscal 2022 ("FY2022"). The Group's revenue was RM648.00 million, 25.5% higher year-on-year (“y-o-y”). EPMB Group Chief Executive Officer – Ahmad Razlan Mohamed said: "We are pleased to report a solid financial performance for FY2023. Our improved results reflect the positive outcome of the transformational work we began in early 2023, focusing on operation and cost optimisation. Moving forward, we will continue to strengthen our core businesses and at the same time, pursue new market opportunities with substantial growth potential. 2024 is set to be an exciting year for the Group as we will start the construction of our new vehicle assembly plant in Melaka. We will manufacture and assemble vehicle models for BAIC International Development Co., Ltd ("BAIC"), and Great Wall Motor Sales Malaysia (“GWM”). Working with prominent automakers will help us build awareness, branding, credibility, and confidence across the industry. I believe this will unlock even greater growth opportunities for EPMB, even as we continue moving up the value chain in line with Malaysia's New Industrial Master Plan ("NIMP") 2030." For the fourth quarter ended 31 December 2023 (“4QFY2023”), EPMB reported revenue of RM199.64 million, its highest in history and a 26.0% increase from RM158.38 million in the immediate preceding quarter ("3QFY2023"). Revenue growth was mainly attributed by increase in sales of automotive parts. In line with the increased revenue, net profit was RM2.94 million, 617.1% higher than RM0.41 million in 3QFY2023. South Korean Tech Giant Expands Operations in Malaysia, Boosting Electronics Industry https://lnkd.in/g4Wsc5mZ Exciting news for the electronics sector in Malaysia! Lotte EM Malaysia Sdn Bhd, a leading manufacturer of Elecfoil (Electrodeposited Copper Foil), has announced plans to expand its operations in the Sama Jaya Free Industrial Zone. This move signifies the company's commitment to further growth and underscores the strong potential of the Malaysian market. Why is this significant? • #Elecfoil is a critical component: It forms the backbone of lithium-ion batteries, a technology powering our modern world, from smartphones to electric vehicles. • Lotte EM Malaysia is a key player: As a foreign investor from South Korea, their expansion reinforces Malaysia's position as a hub for advanced manufacturing and technology. • Sama Jaya Free Industrial Zone offers advantages: This location provides Lotte EM Malaysia with a strategic base to tap into the region's growing demand for Elecfoil. What does this mean for you? • Potential business opportunities: The expansion could lead to increased demand for suppliers, logistics partners, and other related services. • A thriving ecosystem: This development further strengthens the electronics sector in Malaysia, creating a ripple effect of positive economic impact. • Commitment to innovation: Lotte EM Malaysia's expansion signifies confidence in the future of the electronics industry and Malaysia's role within it. With the rising demand for electronics and lithium-ion batteries, Lotte EM Malaysia's expansion in Sama Jaya presents a significant opportunity for the Malaysian market. Their expertise in Elecfoil production makes them a valuable partner for local and regional electronics manufacturers. This expansion is expected to create jobs, transfer technology, and contribute to the development of a robust electronics ecosystem in Malaysia.
